Author: peterkinget
Content:
@Leo Moser (mole99) @Tim 'mithro' Ansell Update/Questions from the MOSbiusV3 team: Yesterday we submitted a GDS to the test-platform and platform. It was able to download the GDS but it looks like the tests did not run since it did not find a top cell. As you know we are doing a full custom design (many thanks to Leo for helping Andrew @asc with the padframe); is there a convention we should follow for the top cell naming, for the GDS file, for anything else? 

I also noticed the platform website offers a Project ID and Manufacturing ID; do they need to be put on the chip. 

There is a QR code in the lower right corner. Right now it reads 0000 so I am guessing it is a place holder. Should we change it? How?

I just uploaded our first version to meet the deadline. The toplevel cell is called `chip_top`. We will be making more changes in the next few days but this GDS has everything + filling so it should pass the large majority of the DRC checks without errors. Fingers crossed. 

Thanks, -- Peter Kinget

Author: mithro_
Content: @peterkinget - I saw the checks, the "top" cell the system found has a weird name like `$$$CONTEXT_INFO$$$`?

Author: mithro_
Content: The precheck will replace the QR Code marker object with the real QRCode

Author: peterkinget
Content: Let's see what happens with the file we just uploaded and take it from there.

Author: mithro_
Content: @peterkinget - It seems to have detected the top cell as `chip_top` for that.

Author: mithro_
Content: Hopefully there will be a precheck run available for you when you wake up tomorrow

Author: mole99
Content:
$$$CONTEXT_INFO$$$ is used by KLayout to store PCell information. See this discussion for more: https://www.klayout.de/forum/discussion/1060/compliance-check-export-stream
Please save the final layout without PCell information.

Author: mithro_
Content: It looks like they must have done that with the final layout as that name is gone now.

Author: asc9742
Content: Yes, we saved without the Pcell information for the latest submission.
